intro: Randia dorothea, commonly known as the yellow randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Randia dorothea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
